quotes.message: You're searching, Joe, for things that don't exist; I mean beginnings. Ends and beginnings -- there are no such things. There are only middles.
quotes.name: Robert Lee Frost

quotes.message: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
quotes.name: Jim Rohn

quotes.message: Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
quotes.name: Plato

quotes.message: From small beginnings come great things.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: Vitality shows in not only the ability to persist but the ability to start over.
quotes.name: F Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.message: Beginnings are always messy.
quotes.name: John Galsworthy

quotes.message: What's well begun, is half done.
quotes.name: Horace

quotes.message: The beginnings of all things are small.
quotes.name: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.message: The last thing one discovers in composing a work is what to put first.
quotes.name: Blaise Pascal

quotes.message: Whatever begins, also ends.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: Whatever you may look like, marry a man your own age -- as your beauty fades, so will his eyesight.
quotes.name: Phyllis Diller

quotes.message: Love built on beauty, soon as beauty, dies.
quotes.name: John Donne

quotes.message: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and all science. He to whom this emotion is a stranger, who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead: his eyes are closed.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: The pursuit of truth and beauty is a sphere of activity in which we are permitted to remain children all our lives.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: One man's justice is another's injustice; one man's beauty another's ugliness; one man's wisdom another's folly.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: We find delight in the beauty and happiness of children that makes the heart too big for the body.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Truth is beautiful, without a doubt. But so are lies.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: It is one of the beautiful compensations of life that no man can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Here's a difference between beauty and charm. A beautiful woman is one I notice. A charming woman is one who notices me.
quotes.name: John Erskine

quotes.message: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.
quotes.name: Anne Frank

quotes.message: If Jack's in love, he's no judge of Jill's beauty.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Keep your faith in all beautiful things; in the sun when it is hidden, in the Spring when it is gone.
quotes.name: Roy R. Gilson

quotes.message: Do you love me because I'm beautiful, or am I am beautiful because you love me?
quotes.name: Oscar Hammerstein

quotes.message: He contemplation of truth and beauty is the proper object for which we were created, which calls forth the most intense desires of the soul, and of which it never tires.
quotes.name: William Hazlitt

quotes.message: What the imagination seizes as beauty must be truth.
quotes.name: John Keats

quotes.message: All God's children are not beautiful. Most of God's children are, in fact, barely presentable.
quotes.name: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.message: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
quotes.name: Anne Spencer Morrow Lindbergh

quotes.message: Every man feels instinctively that all the beautiful sentiments in the world weigh less than a single lovely action.
quotes.name: James Russell Lowell

quotes.message: Develop an interest in life as you see it; the people, things, literature, music-the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself.
quotes.name: Henry Miller

quotes.message: Riches, like glory or heath, have no more beauty or pleasure than their possessor is pleased to lend them.
quotes.name: Michel Eyquem de Montaigne

quotes.message: In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibration of beauty.
quotes.name: Christopher Darlington Morley

quotes.message: To holy people the very name of Jesus is a name to feed upon, a name to transport. His name can raise the dead and transfigure and beautify the living.
quotes.name: ohn Henry Newman

quotes.message: Life has loveliness to sell, All beautiful and splendid things, Blue waves whitened on a cliff, Soaring fire that sways and sings,And children's faces looking up,Holding wonder like a cup.
quotes.name: Sara Teasdale

quotes.message: Everytime you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
quotes.name: Mother Teresa

quotes.message: The longer I live the more beautiful life becomes.
quotes.name: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.message: Rarely do great beauty and great virtue dwell together.
quotes.name: Petrarch

quotes.message: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.
quotes.name: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.message: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: Everytime you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
quotes.name: Mother Teresa

quotes.message: I've learned ... that a smile is an inexpensive way to improve your looks.
quotes.name: Andy Rooney
